intro: Rhodax piloselloides, commonly known as the hairy cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in the spring. Rhodax piloselloides is often found in disturbed soils and can spread through rhizomes.
